item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, April 17, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Zoom outage caused by accidental 'shutting down' of the zoom.us domain (252 points | 120 comments)
2. Jellyfin as a Spotify alternative (220 points | 188 comments)
3. OpenAI Codex CLI: Lightweight coding agent that runs in your terminal (379 points | 203 comments)
4. Darwin's children drew all over the “On the Origin of Species” manuscript (2014) (367 points | 104 comments)
5. Concurrency in Haskell: Fast, Simple, Correct (53 points | 20 comments)
6. Show HN: Plandex v2 – open source AI coding agent for large projects and tasks (96 points | 23 comments)
7. 12-factor Agents: Patterns of reliable LLM applications (285 points | 47 comments)
8. Demolishing the Fry's Electronics in Burbank (100 points | 62 comments)
9. TLS certificate lifetimes will officially reduce to 47 days (407 points | 530 comments)
10. Damn Vulnerable MCP Server (172 points | 51 comments)
11. "Vivarium": The keeper of a lab's animals stumbles onto a secret [fiction] (29 points | 5 comments)
12. Man who built ISP instead of paying Comcast expands to hundreds of homes (2022) (376 points | 171 comments)
13. Unix files have (at least) two sizes (50 points | 18 comments)
14. How a Forgotten Battle Created a More Peaceful World (79 points | 27 comments)
15. Query Engines: Push vs. Pull (2021) (54 points | discuss)
16. In Two Moves, AlphaGo and Lee Sedol Redefined the Future (2016) (7 points | 1 comment)
17. Kermit: A typeface for kids (290 points | 143 comments)
18. How Nintendo bled Atari games to death (183 points | 128 comments)
19. OpenAI o3 and o4-mini (467 points | 425 comments)
20. eInk Mode: Making web pages easier to read (105 points | 36 comments)
21. CVE Foundation (324 points | 64 comments)
22. Reproducing Hacker News writing style fingerprinting (241 points | 121 comments)
23. OneSignal (YC S11) Is Hiring Engineers ( | hide)
24. Breaking the Llama Community License (122 points | 67 comments)
25. Nix Trigonometric Math Library from Ground Zero (28 points | 2 comments)
26. A high-throughput parser for the Zig programming language (112 points | 9 comments)
27. Sony Unveils the Smallest and Lightest Lidar Depth Sensor (42 points | 13 comments)
28. Microsoft researchers developed a hyper-efficient AI model that can run on CPUs (104 points | 39 comments)
29. RakuAST Grant Report (45 points | 2 comments)
30. Dirty tricks 6502 programmers use (2019) (145 points | 44 comments)
